New Mexico Public Education Department
March 27 at 10:14 AM Â·

Today Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham

"The Vietnam War was the first war broadcast on television, and we learned first-hand how hellish it was for the soldiers. A little-known perspective that often wasn't shown on the nightly news: it was hell for women overseas, too, and the New Mexico School for the Arts is producing a play to platform exactly those stories. This play is heavy and due to content is suitable only for a mature audience, but the retrospective it offers on the war's legacy is invaluable."

We are so thankful for the amazing guest artist appearance by four-time GRAMMY nominated artist Gerald Clayton

Gerald is performing this evening at SITE Santa Fe, presented by Santa Fe Music Collective and John Trentacosta.

The name Gerald Clayton has almost become a household name in jazz today. Following in the footsteps of his famous father, bassist John Clayton, and uncle, saxophonist Jeff Clayton, Gerald learned his music lessons well at an early age, and forged ahead to establish an amazing career for himself as a pianist, composer and bandleader. Appearing in a Quartet setting with Logan Richardson - alto saxophone, Joe Sanders iNfinity - bass, and Kendrick Scott - drums, the "Gerald Clayton Quartet" brings the perfect blend of tradition with a younger modern approach.

This master class was presented by Santa Fe Music Collective in partnership with National Endowment for the Arts and Western Jazz Presenters Network

We are so proud of our musician ambassadors from NMSA that recently completed their trip to and participation in the Chengdu International Sister Cities Youth Music Festival in Chengdu, China!

Thanks to Mayor Alan Webber and the City of Santa Fe for supporting our young artists!

John Trentacosta, co-founding director of the NMSA Jazz Ensemble, chaperoned the group. Here's a note from him:

"Our kids bonded with other young musicians from all over the world, in friendship and music. They jammed together in the evenings and enjoyed socializing with their newly found friends during meals... Our tour guides became part of our family. In addition to all of the above, our kids represented NMSA, Santa Fe, New Mexico and the United States in a very positive light, always portraying themselves as young professionals and grateful to our hosts."

#NMSA #NmSchoolfortheArts #Music
